newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sanyo Sec shares fall on loan delay request.
newsitem.headline: Sanyo Sec shares fall on loan delay request.

text.p: Shares in Sanyo Securities Co Ltd lost ground on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on Friday morning following news that the company asked several life insurers to delay repayment of its subordinated loans.
As of 0016 GMT, the shares were down eight yen at 186 yen.
A Sanyo Securities spokesman told Reuters earlier on Friday that the company had asked life insurers for a postponement of repayment of subordinated debts due at the end of July.

The spokesman said that the medium-sized brokerage has a total of 20 billion yen in subordinated loans from life insurers, including Nippon Life Insurance Co. He did not disclose, however, how much of that amount was due for repayment later this month.
